idea_title: Strain-Engineered Magnetic Anisotropy and Spin Transport in Janus CrXY (X,Y = S, Se, Te) Monolayers for 2D Spintronics
workflow_title: Computational Workflow for Strain-Dependent Magnetic Properties in Janus CrXY Monolayers
summary: This workflow is designed to systematically test the hypothesis that Janus CrXY monolayers exhibit enhanced and tunable magnetic anisotropy energy (MAE) under biaxial strain due to broken inversion symmetry and strain-modified orbital hybridization. technician_steps.title: Generate initial Janus CrXY (X,Y = S, Se, Te) monolayer structures
Relax initial Janus structures to validate stability and obtain equilibrium geometry
Loop over strain values from -8% to +8% in 2% increments
Apply biaxial strain to relaxed structure
Relax ionic positions under fixed strained lattice
Calculate MAE for strained structure with SOC for two magnetization directions
Calculate band structure and DOS for strained system
Calculate exchange parameters for Heisenberg model via energy mapping
Perform Monte Carlo simulation to estimate Curie temperature
Collect and analyze all strain-dependent data
